meanings.definition: The classification of organisms based on their cellular characteristics.
meanings.sent1: Scientists use cytotaxonomy to group animals based on their cell features.
meanings.sent2: Cytotaxonomy helps scientists understand how different organisms are related by looking at their cell traits.
meanings.sent3: In the world of cytotaxonomy, cells are like puzzle pieces that help scientists solve the mystery of classification.
meanings.sent4: The world of cytotaxonomy is a cellular jigsaw puzzle where each piece reveals a different taxonomic relationship.
meanings.sent5: Through cytotaxonomy, organisms are classified like a library organizing books by their covers.

meanings.definition: The study of the taxonomic relationships between organisms using their cell structures.
meanings.sent1: Cytotaxonomy involves examining cell structures to understand how organisms are related in the taxonomic system.
meanings.sent2: Researchers in cytotaxonomy compare cell structures to determine the evolutionary connections between different species.
meanings.sent3: When studying cytotaxonomy, scientists play a cellular detective game to uncover the hidden relationships between organisms.
meanings.sent4: The field of cytotaxonomy is like a genetic family tree where cell structures are the branches connecting different species.
meanings.sent5: In cytotaxonomy, cells act as tiny storytellers revealing the evolutionary saga of organisms.
